{{Rot resistance 3}}, {{Drown resistance}} |vulnerabilities=None |max_chunks=0 |meat={{No corpse}} |xp=205 |holiness={{Nonliving}} |magic_resistance=64 |hp_range=28-59 |avg_hp=43 |armour_class=20 |evasion=4 |habitat=Land |speed= 7 |size={{Medium}} |item_use={{Open doors}} |attack1=19 ({{Bite type}}: {{Plain flavour}}) |attack2=10 ({{Claw type}}: {{Plain flavour}}) |attack3=10 ({{Claw type}}: {{Plain flavour}}) |attack4= |hit_dice=8 |base_hp=3 |extra_hp=5 |fixed_hp=0 |intelligence={{High intelligence}} |genus=gargoyle |species=metal gargoyle }} {{Flavour|A hideous metal statue come to life.}} ==Useful Info== '''Metal gargoyles''' are stronger, tougher, and slower than regular [[gargoyle (monster)|gargoyles]], but are otherwise identical. They inhabit [[the Iron City of Dis]]. ==Tips & Tricks== By the time you encounter them, metal gargoyles are nearly harmless, at least in comparison to everything else you'll be facing. They are easy targets for [[Lee's Rapid Deconstruction]], causing them to explode and injure all monsters standing nearby. ==History== Metal gargoyles were replaced with [[war gargoyle]]s in [[0.14]].
